Text: I will bless the LORD at all times; His praise shall continually be on my lips.
Context: This introductory verse sets the tone of the Psalm as one of perpetual praise, regardless of circumstances.

Text: My soul will boast in the LORD; let the afflicted hear and rejoice.
Context: This verse contrasts the boastful soul in God with the state of the afflicted, calling them to experience joy.

Text: Magnify the LORD with me; let us exalt His name together.
Context: An invitation to corporate worship, emphasizing community and unity in the act of exalting God.

Text: I sought the LORD, and He answered me; He delivered me from all my fears.
Context: A testimony of personal experience, showing God's responsiveness and deliverance from fear.

Text: Those who look to Him are radiant with joy; their faces shall never be covered with shame.
Context: This portrays an inner joy and confidence that comes from seeking God, resulting in freedom from shame.

Text: This poor man called out, and the LORD heard him; He saved him from all his troubles.
Context: A specific example of God responding to the cry of the individual in need.

Text: The angel of the LORD encamps around those who fear Him, and he delivers them.
Context: Reflects a belief in divine protection for those who revere the LORD, involving the angel of the LORD.

Text: Taste and see that the LORD is good; blessed is the man who takes refuge in Him.
Context: Encourages experiencing God's goodness personally, with a blessing for those who seek shelter in Him.

Text: Fear the LORD, you His saints, for those who fear Him lack nothing.
Context: Links fear of the LORD with the promise of provision, implying contentment and satisfaction.

Text: The young lions go lacking and hungry, but those who seek the LORD lack no good thing.
Context: A comparison to emphasize the provision for those who genuinely seek the LORD, surpassing even strong and capable creatures.

Text: Come, children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
Context: Calls for attention to impart wisdom on what it means to fear and revere the LORD.

Text: Who is the man who desires life, loving a long life to enjoy good things?
Context: Poses a rhetorical question reflecting on the desire for a fulfilling life.

Text: Keep your tongue from evil and your lips from deceitful speech.
Context: Practical advice on living a life pleasing to the LORD by controlling one's speech.

Text: Turn away from evil and do good; seek peace and pursue it.
Context: Further guidance on righteous living through active pursuit of peace and goodness.

Text: The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, and His ears are attentive to their cry.
Context: An assurance of God's attentive nature towards those living righteously.

Text: The face of the LORD is against those who do evil, to wipe out the memory of them from the earth.
Context: Stark contrast to the previous verse, warning those who do evil of God's opposition.

Text: The righteous cry out, and the LORD hears; He delivers them from all their troubles.
Context: Reaffirms the LORD's responsiveness and deliverance as a comfort to the righteous in distress.

Text: The LORD is near the brokenhearted; He saves the contrite in spirit.
Context: Emphasizes God's closeness and salvation for those who are humbled and in despair.

Text: Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the LORD delivers him from them all.
Context: Recognizes the multiple trials the righteous face while reasserting God's deliverance.

Text: He protects all his bones; not one of them will be broken.
Context: Speaks metaphorically of God's protection over the righteous, ensuring complete preservation.

Text: Evil will slay the wicked; the foes of the righteous will be condemned.
Context: Highlights the self-destructive nature of evil and the assured downfall of those opposing the righteous.

Text: The LORD redeems His servants; no one who takes refuge in Him will be condemned.
Context: Offers a final promise of redemption and protection for those who trust in the LORD.
